conclusion: The problem involves calculating the height H at which a projectile fired from an electromagnetic railgun fire truck hits a high-rise building, given initial velocity, launch angle, and horizontal distance.
Given values: L = 60 m, v0 = 50 m/s, θ = 53°, g = 10 m/s², sin(53°) = 0.8.
The initial velocity components are expressed as v0x = v0 * cos(θ) and v0y = v0 * sin(θ).
The horizontal velocity component is v0x = 50 * 0.6 = 30 m/s.
The vertical velocity component is v0y = 50 * 0.8 = 40 m/s.
The time to reach the building is calculated as t = L / v0x = 60 / 30 = 2 seconds.
The vertical position of the projectile at time t is given by y = v0y * t - (1/2) * g * t².
Substituting values into the vertical position equation: H = 40 * 2 - (1/2) * 10 * 2² = 80 - 20 = 60 meters.
The fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building at a height of H = 60 meters above the ground.
